speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe the newborn's breathing pattern and any cyanosis observed?

speaker: Patient
text: "I've been making a bit of a gurgling sound when I breathe in, and my skin sometimes looks a little bluish around my nose and mouth, especially when I get tired or when I cry."

speaker: Doctor
text: Is there any cyanosis noted around the lips or nails? How about rapid or labored breathing?

speaker: Patient
text: "Yes, doctor, the bluish coloration is around my nose and mouth, and it seems to be more pronounced when I get really upset or try to breathe in more deeply. It's like my skin is having trouble getting enough oxygen or something."

speaker: Doctor
text: Are there any signs of fever or rash on the skin?

speaker: Patient
text: "Actually, yes, there are these weird, little marks on my skin that don't change color when I press on them, but they're kind of visible even when I'm relaxed."

speaker: Doctor
text: Have they had any difficulty feeding or vomiting? REQUEST TEST: Blood gas analysis.

speaker: Doctor
text: Any coughing or wheezing sounds when breathing? REQUEST TEST: Blood culture.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have they experienced any episodes of apnea or sudden pauses in breathing? DIAGNOSIS READY: Possible congenital diaphragmatic hernia; consider other respiratory issues based on symptoms.
